derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): from Latin subscriptio(n-), from subscribere 'write below' (see subscribe)

entry.tran: 会员费;用户费;捐助款;订阅费
entry.def: A subscription is an amount of money that you pay regularly in order to belong to an organization, to help a charity or campaign, or to receive copies of a magazine or newspaper.

example.ex: You can become a member by paying the yearly subscription.
example.tran: 支付一年的会员费就可以成为会员。

entry.tran: (电视或电视频道)付费的，收费的
entry.def: Subscription television is television that you can watch only if you pay a subscription. A subscription channel is a channel that you can watch only if you pay a subscription.

example.ex: Premiere, a subscription channel which began in 1991, shows live football covering the top two divisions...
example.tran: 开播于 1991 年的付费电视频道 premiere 实况转播两大顶级足球联赛的赛事。

example.ex: East Coast Pay Television was Australia's first digital direct broadcast satellite subscription television service.
example.tran: 东海岸付费电视台是澳大利亚第一家提供数字化卫星直播服务的收费电视频道。

means.word_mean: 1. a payment for consecutive issues of a newspaper or magazine for a given period of time
2. agreement expressed by (or as if expressed by) signing your name
4. the act of signing your name; writing your signature (as on a document);

sentences.sentence: "the deed was attested by the subscription of his signature"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 捐献, 订金, 订阅, 签署
stems_affixes.word_buile: subscrip=subscribe[v.捐献,订购]+tion表名词→n.捐献, 订金, 订阅, 签署
con大家+scrib写+e→大家写上名字→征兵
pre预先+scrib写+e→预先写好的→规定;处方
scrib写+e→n.抄写员,作者 v.划线
sub下面+scrib写+e→在下面写上名字[签名]→订购
trans转移+scrib写+e→把写的东西移到[另一张纸上]→transcribe抄写

Sentence.sentence: It can include them in subscription deals sold to libraries or sell them individually under a consumer licence.
Google will be able to display up to 20% of orphan works for free, include them in its subscription deals to libraries and sell them to individual buyers under the consumer licence
